name: Mehuli Ghosh
biography: Mehuli Ghosh is an Indian sport shooter who has made a significant impact in the sport. She has overcome several challenges, including an early setback where she accidentally injured an onlooker, which led to depression and a lack of a coach until she joined Joydeep Karmakar's academy. Despite these hurdles, Ghosh has emerged as a new star on the Indian shooting horizon, winning two bronze medals at the ISSF World Cup in Guadalajara, Mexico.
childhood: Mehuli Ghosh was born in Baidyabati, West Bengal. She took up shooting at a young age and initially faced challenges, including a serious injury to an onlooker. This incident led to depression and a lack of a coach until she joined Joydeep Karmakar's academy in Kolkata. Her family, including her mother Mithali Ghosh, supported her throughout these challenges.
professional_career: Ghosh's professional career has seen significant growth. She has won multiple medals at national championships and international junior championships. Her breakthrough came at the ISSF World Cup in Guadalajara, Mexico, where she won two bronze medals. This achievement secured an Olympic quota place for India at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Ghosh is supported by the Olympic Gold Quest (OGQ) program and continues to train under Joydeep Karmakar.
